As n\to\infty , a_{n} and g_{n} converge to a common limit M\left(a_{0},g_{0}\right) called the AGM (Arithmetic-Geometric Mean) of a_{0} and g_{0}.
By symmetry in a_{0} and g_{0} we may assume a_{0}\geq g_{0} and define c_{n}=\sqrt{a_{n}^{2}-g_{n}^{2}}.
Then c_{n+1}=\frac{a_{n}-g_{n}}{2}=\frac{c_{n}^{2}}{4a_{n+1}}, showing that the convergence of c_{n} to 0 and of a_{n} and g_{n} to M\left(a_{0},g_{0}\right) is quadratic in each case.
